summary: Email from attorney Bruce Barket requesting to view physical evidence related to Jeffrey Epstein's July 23, 2019 attempted suicide while incarcerated in the same cell as Nicholas Tartaglione. The email is sent to an unspecified recipient, with Aida Leisenring copied, regarding arranging a viewing.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney sending an email to arrange viewing of physical evidence related to Jeffrey Epstein's attempted suicide. He is from the law firm Barket Epstein Kearon Aldea & LoTurco, LLP.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the evidence viewing request; the email references his attempted suicide on July 23, 2019, while incarcerated.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Mentioned as the individual who shared a cell with Jeffrey Epstein at the time of Epstein's attempted suicide.

persons.name: Aida Leisenring
persons.context: Copied on the email from Bruce Barket regarding the evidence viewing arrangement.

connections.description: Bruce Barket, as an attorney, is acting on behalf of or in relation to Jeffrey Epstein by requesting to view evidence related to Epstein's attempted suicide.
The document states Epstein and Tartaglione were incarcerated in the same cell at the time of Epstein's attempted suicide.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Attempted Suicide
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein attempted suicide while incarcerated in the same cell as Nicholas Tartaglione.

events.title: Attorney Request to View Evidence
events.description: Attorney Bruce Barket sends an email requesting to arrange a viewing of physical evidence from Epstein's July 23, 2019 attempted suicide.

keyFacts: The document is an email from attorney Bruce Barket dated January 10, 2020, regarding evidence from Jeffrey Epstein's July 23, 2019 attempted suicide.
Epstein was incarcerated in the same cell as Nicholas Tartaglione at the time of the attempted suicide.
The email seeks to arrange a viewing of physical evidence related to the incident.
The correspondence highlights ongoing legal and investigative activities related to Epstein's death in custody.
